task_summary: Detect and pick up the brown object on the table using a top grasp, then lift and hold it briefly before retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop manipulation scene shows several bottles, cans, and small blocks. The goal is to pick up the brown object visible toward the left side of the workspace. The arm should open the gripper, approach from above, align precisely, compute a top grasp, and close to secure the item. After confirming a stable grasp, the robot lifts the object a short distance, holds it, and retreats to clear the workspace. No placement is required; only a reliable pickup and lift are necessary.
preconditions: Brown object is present on the table and within reachable workspace
Perception can detect the brown object
No obstacles between TCP and target
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and move above the object
Approach and align with tight tolerance
Verify visibility and compute a top grasp pose
Raise the held object, hold briefly, and retreat
success_criteria: Object is firmly in the gripper
Object lifted at least 0.10 m from the surface
Robot retreats to a safe distance
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, reattempt detection or adjust view
If alignment fails, re-approach with relaxed tolerance
If grasp slips, reopen gripper and recompute grasp
If contact forces exceed limits, abort and retreat
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after a stable lift, brief hold, and successful retreat.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Move to a pregrasp height above the object.
Align TCP with object for grasping.
Verify object still visible before grasp.
Compute a top grasp and store under std_top.
Confirm the correct object is held.
Lift the object off the table.
Hold briefly to ensure secure grasp.

recovery_strategy: Adjust view or height then retry
assumptions: "Brown object" refers to the small brown/orange stack visible on the left side of the table in multiple frames; no placement is required after pickup.

expected_success_criteria: Object detected, grasped, lifted 0.10 m, and robot retreats safely
